intro: Calystegia macrostegia subsp. intermedia, commonly known as the slender bladderbladder, is a herbaceous vine native to North America. It is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture. The flowers are yellow with five petals and are borne in clusters along the stems. The fruit is a bladder-like capsule that splits open to release seeds. This species thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks.
